Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack.synopsis: Dialog with a werewolf in the Ballroom. After the dialog the werewolf attacks you.Potentially we would want to show other NPCs in the room.
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack.how_to_trigger: use ReCon commands:give S_LOW_CazadorsPalace_Bedrooms_AncientLanguageBookgive S_LOW_CazadorsPalace_Kennel_SzarrRinggoto -84; 55; 36click on the door in front of youenter the room

RitualRoom_AD_SpawnFreed_001_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_SpawnFreed_001_Combat_0.text: Freeing them achieves nothing - my children will never harm me.

RitualRoom_AD_RitualFailure_Astarion_0.speaker: Astarion
RitualRoom_AD_RitualFailure_Astarion_0.text: No, what have you done? You ruined everything!
RitualRoom_AD_RitualFailure_Astarion_0.context: NodeContext: The player's just killed someone you needed to complete the Black Mass Ritual, meaning you can't ascend to become a vampire lord

RitualRoom_PAD_AstarionTalksToCazador_00.speaker: Astarion
RitualRoom_PAD_AstarionTalksToCazador_00.text: I won't let you do this. I won't let you win.

Cells_Prisoner_002_0.speaker: Wensleydale
Cells_Prisoner_002_0.text: No, please, master. Not again, master.
Cells_Prisoner_002_0.context: NodeContext: as if scared he's about to be beaten

Cells_Prisoner_002_1.speaker: Wensleydale
Cells_Prisoner_002_1.text: I'm sorry, master. I'm so sorry.
Cells_Prisoner_002_1.context: NodeContext: as if scared he's about to be beaten

Servant_001_10.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_10.text: There is so much to do. So much to make ready.

Servant_001_16.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_16.text: Master Astarion? What are you doing here? Why aren't you downstairs?

Servant_001_30.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_30.text: The doors have already been sealed - the ritual is about to begin!

Servant_001_83.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_83.text: How can you not know? It's the master's ascension!

Servant_001_77.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_77.text: Tonight he is reborn, even more perfect than before, and his blessings will rain down upon us.

Servant_001_78.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_78.text: All his children were to attend - your brothers and sisters are there already. He'll be furious you didn't make it.

Servant_001_72.speaker: Player
Servant_001_72.text: So unseal the doors and let me in.

Servant_001_56.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_56.text: It's too late, Godey has sealed the doors and will not open them until the ritual is complete.

Servant_001_19.speaker: Narrator
Servant_001_19.text: *You remember the ill-tempered skeleton Godey, though you may wish to forget him.*

Servant_001_88.speaker: Narrator
Servant_001_88.text: *Officially, he was keeper of the palace's kennels, but you knew him as Cazador's muscle - beating you when the master didn't want to do it himself.*

Servant_001_28.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_28.text: The master will be so angry with you. He will do such terrible, terrible things to you.
Servant_001_28.context: NodeContext: almost worried he'll be overheard

Servant_001_51.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_51.text: I'm wasting time talking to a damned man. There is too much to do - too much to prepare.

Servant_001_86.speaker: Player
Servant_001_86.text: Take my advice - run. Get out of here while you still can.

Servant_001_1.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_1.text: Abandon the master? At his moment of triumph?

Servant_001_96.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_96.text: What is wrong with you? Do you wish to spite him again?
Servant_001_96.context: NodeContext: almost worried they'll be overheard

Servant_001_91.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_91.context: NodeContext: Can't believe what he just heard

Servant_001_49.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_49.text: You will not raise a finger against him, you ungrateful, wretched little child!

Servant_001_21.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_21.text: Another guest for the master's celebration? But you're so late - the doors are sealed. All is underway.

Servant_001_45.speaker: Player
Servant_001_45.text: I have a Szarr family ring. Are you really going to turn me away?

Servant_001_26.speaker: Player
Servant_001_26.text: I love celebrations! What's the occasion?

Servant_001_81.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_81.text: Tonight the master completes his ritual of ascension, and - well, the specifics are a matter for those inside.
Servant_001_81.context: NodeContext: reigns in his initial enthusiasm

Servant_001_36.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_36.text: If you wished to join us, you are too late. The master has commanded the doors stay shut until the ritual is complete.

Servant_001_42.speaker: Player
Servant_001_42.text: So unseal them and let me in.

Servant_001_67.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_67.text: We cannot, the master forbids it. None are to enter, none are to leave.

Servant_001_12.speaker: Player
Servant_001_12.text: It can't be underway yet - I'm the entertainment!

Servant_001_44.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_44.text: The master does enjoy a fool...

Servant_001_68.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_68.text: The master's ascension is a solemn, beautiful event. It does not require 'entertainment'.

Servant_001_84.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_84.text: But it matters not, the doors are sealed. None are to enter, none are to leave.

Servant_001_0.speaker: Player
Servant_001_0.text: I know all about the ritual - I'm an honoured guest, not a sacrifice.

Servant_001_58.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_58.text: You're to witness the master's ascension? Oh what fortune. What blessed eyes!

Servant_001_4.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_4.text: But please, forgive me, I cannot unseal the doors. The master's kennel keeper - Godey - only he is trusted to open them.

Servant_001_8.speaker: Player
Servant_001_8.text: With this ring? Is that how he unlocks them?

Servant_001_54.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_54.text: Forgive me, I did not know you are a member of the family.

Servant_001_65.speaker: Player
Servant_001_65.text: I met Godey, but he didn't have a key.

Servant_001_95.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_95.text: He wears the Szarr family signet. Only members of the family can unseal the doors.

Servant_001_52.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_52.text: Now please, I need to prepare - all must be perfect for the master when he ascends.

Servant_001_18.speaker: Player
Servant_001_18.text: And where do I find Godey?

Servant_001_98.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_98.text: If you must find him, he lurks in the kennels below.

Servant_001_92.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_92.text: I must prepare. Soon he will ascend and all must be ready for him.

Servant_001_34.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_34.text: Don't you understand? The master forbids the doors be opened, and the master cannot be disobeyed.

Servant_001_17.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_17.text: Forgive me, but there is nothing I can do for you.

Servant_001_47.speaker: Player
Servant_001_47.text: Excuse me? Your master invited me personally.

Servant_001_24.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_24.text: Well, if the master insists you are to be there, then you must be there.

Servant_001_48.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_48.text: The master does not invite people 'personally'. The master does not demean himself so.

Servant_001_99.speaker: Player
Servant_001_99.text: Your master will be furious if I'm not there. And he'll take it out on you.

Servant_001_61.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_61.text: The master's anger can be... extreme, this is true.

Servant_001_9.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_9.text: The master will do as he wishes, but I will not disobey his command.

Servant_001_73.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_73.text: But now I must prepare. His time is almost here and there is still so much to do.

Servant_001_53.speaker: Player
Servant_001_53.text: Don't worry, I was just leaving.

Servant_001_80.speaker: Player
Servant_001_80.text: I'm here to kill your master.

Servant_001_37.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_37.text: Another guest for the master's celebration? I'm afraid you're too late, you'll have to-
Servant_001_37.context: NodeContext: going to say "I'm afraid you'll have to leave", but then spotted Astarion

Servant_001_50.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_50.text: Master Astarion? What are you doing here? Why aren't you downstairs?!
Servant_001_50.context: NodeContext: Spots Astarion in the group - shocked

Servant_001_32.speaker: Astarion
Servant_001_32.text: Well, obviously I'm on my way down now. So if you could just point us in the right direction...
Servant_001_32.context: NodeContext: bluffing - he has no idea he's meant to be downstairs

Servant_001_64.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_64.text: But you're too late. The doors have been sealed - the ritual is about to begin!

Servant_001_39.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_39.text: Perhaps we should not discuss this around strangers...

Servant_001_76.speaker: Astarion
Servant_001_76.text: Speak, damn it! What's going on?
Servant_001_76.context: NodeContext: not angry, just barking an order

Servant_001_46.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_46.text: It's the master's ascension. Once the ritual is complete, he is to be reborn, even more perfect and powerful than before.

Servant_001_100.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_100.text: You should be there - all his children were to attend. He'll be furious you're not.

Servant_001_38.speaker: Player
Servant_001_38.text: So unseal the doors and let us in.

Servant_001_27.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_27.text: It's too late, Godey has sealed the doors and will not open them until the ritual is complete.

Servant_001_14.speaker: Astarion
Servant_001_14.text: Cazador gave the key to Godey? And where is the sadistic old sack of bones?

Servant_001_94.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_94.text: It does not matter, you're too late!

Servant_001_75.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_75.text: The master will be so angry that you missed the ritual. He will do such terrible, terrible things to you.
Servant_001_75.context: NodeContext: almost worried he'll be overheard

Servant_001_20.speaker: Player
Servant_001_20.text: Take my advice - run. Get out of here while you still can.

Servant_001_5.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_5.text: Abandon the master? At his moment of triumph?

Servant_001_3.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_3.text: What is wrong with you? Do you wish to spite him again?
Servant_001_3.context: NodeContext: almost worried they'll be overheard

Servant_001_22.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_22.text: I do not have any more time to waste. There is too much to do - too much to prepare.

Servant_001_2.speaker: Player
Servant_001_2.text: We're here to kill your master.

Servant_001_93.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_93.text: You won't raise a finger against him! I won't let you!

Servant_001_62.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_62.text: A new master arises. A new master must be served.

Servant_001_63.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_63.text: It's not true. Master can't be gone - master is eternal.

Servant_001_79.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_79.text: You are late for our celebration - the doors are sealed.

Servant_001_97.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_97.text: There is so much to do. So much to prepare.

GuardTower_Guard_003_0.speaker: Reklan
GuardTower_Guard_003_0.text: Tonight is a sacred night. We are all blessed to be here.

GuardTower_Guard_003_1.speaker: Reklan
GuardTower_Guard_003_1.text: You must hurry - the master expects all children at the ritual.

GuardTower_Guard_003_2.speaker: Reklan
GuardTower_Guard_003_2.text: The time is almost upon us.

PreparationRoom_AD_Ritualist_0.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_AD_Ritualist_0.text: Rest, little runaway. Once you're strong enough to survive, we will begin.

RitualRoom_AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_0.text: Fight on if you must, but I am only growing stronger.

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_23.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_23.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_22.speaker: Party Guest
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_22.text: Sterlac... Senior Clerk in Counting House...

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_21.speaker: Player
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_21.text: What was a clerk doing here?

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_12.speaker: Party Guest
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_12.text: Work... Counting House... who controls what...

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_28.speaker: Party Guest
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_28.text: Wanted names of senior staff... families... any scandals, secrets...

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_27.speaker: Party Guest
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_27.text: Wolves... arrived when our host left... slaughtered us...

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_3.speaker: Party Guest
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_3.text: West door... took most beautiful people away... never saw again...

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_17.speaker: Party Guest
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_17.text: Politicians... minor nobles... Fist officers... all sorts...

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_1.text: What did he want with these people?

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_19.speaker: Party Guest
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_19.text: Power structures in city... weaknesses... who he needed to control...

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_26.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_29.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_Guest_002_Dead_29.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_2.speaker: Player
Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_2.text: The engravings on the ring match the language on that strange door. I still can't read it, though.

Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_3.speaker: Player
Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_3.text: There's an inscription on the ring. Looks like the same language as that book from earlier.

Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_4.speaker: Player
Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_4.text: There's an inscription on the ring. I don't recognise the language, though.

Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_5.speaker: Player
Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_5.text: The Szarr signet ring. I've never seen it up this close.

Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_1.speaker: Player
Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_1.text: There's even an inscription on here, in the same language as on the ballroom door.  Not that I can read a word of it.

Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_0.speaker: Player
Kennel_PAD_RingAndBook_0.text: There's even some chicken scratch inscription on here, in god knows what language. Though I have seen it somewhere before...

Cells_Prisoner_001_0.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_Prisoner_001_0.text: It never stops. The hunger never stops...

Cells_Prisoner_001_1.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_Prisoner_001_1.context: InternalNodeContext: OM happened, prisoner pissed at AstarionNodeContext: Small voice, lost in his own head, still cursing Astarion

Cells_Prisoner_001_2.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_Prisoner_001_2.text: Please, go. Do whatever you have to.
Cells_Prisoner_001_2.context: InternalNodeContext: OM happened, Astarion escaped the grapple without attacking the prisoner.

Cells_Prisoner_001_4.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_Prisoner_001_4.context: InternalNodeContext: OM happened, prisoner pissed at AstarionNodeContext: Small voice, lost in his own head, still cursing Astarion

Cells_Prisoner_001_5.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_Prisoner_001_5.text: Leave me. Leave me to the fate you made for me.
Cells_Prisoner_001_5.context: InternalNodeContext: OM happened, Astarion escaped the grapple without attacking the prisoner.

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_0.speaker: Aurelia
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_0.text: He... he is destroyed. Cazador. Gone! How were you able to do this?

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_8.speaker: Aurelia
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_8.text: Look at us - we are no threat. Let us go, we'll vanish into the Undercity, you'll never see us again. I beg you!

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_1.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_1.text: You are victims. You may go.

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_4.speaker: Aurelia
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_4.text: You won't regret this! I swear it.

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_2.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_2.text: Beg for your freedom, lowly spawn.

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_5.speaker: Aurelia
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_5.text: Please... master? May I call you master? All, any of us who survive, we'll disappear now. You'll never see us again.

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_3.speaker: Aurelia
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_3.text: My head... Do I know you? Why are your features a smear across your face?

RitualRoom_Spawn_002_6.speaker: Aurelia
RitualRoom_Spawn_002_6.text: The master is dead. I can't come to grips with it. Now what? What now?

RitualRoom_AD_SpawnKilled_002_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_SpawnKilled_002_Combat_0.text: My children - my ritual! You've ruined everything!

GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_16.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_16.text: Y-y-you one of them? The fangy ones?

GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_5.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_5.text: Big. Hairy. Teeth. They're mean. Real mean. Stay away.

GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_15.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_15.text: Good. Don't like when they change. Get big. Hairy. Mean. Make sure you stay away.

GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_20.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_20.text: No. Your teeth are pointy but tiny. The mean, hairy fangy ones would maul you.

GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_11.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_11.text: Stay still - allowing the rat to come closer.

GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_12.speaker: Narrator
GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_12.text: *The rat cautiously sniffs you. With a squeak, she visibly relaxes.*

GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_0.speaker: Narrator
GuardTower_Rat_001_SwA_0.text: *Someone, or something, has scared her - badly. You, however, are neither foe nor food. Perhaps even a friend.*

RitualRoom_Dalyria_2.speaker: Dalyria
RitualRoom_Dalyria_2.text: I cannot believe it's over. I cannot believe we're free.

RitualRoom_Dalyria_7.speaker: Dalyria
RitualRoom_Dalyria_7.text: We are free, aren't we? We will not bother you at the surface, you have my word on that.
RitualRoom_Dalyria_7.context: NodeContext: hesitant, realising the player might not her go

RitualRoom_Dalyria_3.speaker: Dalyria
RitualRoom_Dalyria_3.text: We will find a place in the Underdark. We will find a new way to live, new creatures to feed on, and you will never have to see us again.

RitualRoom_Dalyria_8.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Dalyria_8.text: Of course you're free. Good luck down there.

RitualRoom_Dalyria_1.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Dalyria_1.text: I can't let you go - you're too dangerous.

RitualRoom_Dalyria_6.speaker: Dalyria
RitualRoom_Dalyria_6.text: Perhaps you're right. Perhaps we are dangerous.
RitualRoom_Dalyria_6.context: NodeContext: about to attack the player

RitualRoom_Dalyria_4.speaker: Dalyria
RitualRoom_Dalyria_4.text: Is he resting? Will the master rise again?

PreparationRoom_36.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_36.text: *A familiar stink fills your nostrils - you're back in 'the Kennel', where you spent days, tendays being tortured by Cazador's sadistic servant Godey.*

PreparationRoom_21.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_21.text: Nasty little runaway. But you always find your way back to Godey, hmm?

PreparationRoom_41.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_41.text: If I had my way, I'd saw off your legs - that'd put a stop to your wandering.

PreparationRoom_3.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_3.text: But the master says no. Says he needs all of your blood on the inside for the Mass.

PreparationRoom_27.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_27.text: But he needs you obedient too. No barking, no biting, no struggling - a well-behaved little doggie.

PreparationRoom_13.speaker: Astarion
PreparationRoom_13.text: I'll never do what he tells me again - I'd rather die.

PreparationRoom_15.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_15.text: Oh, you'll do both. You'll do whatever he requires.

PreparationRoom_8.speaker: Astarion
PreparationRoom_8.text: He has no power over me anymore.

PreparationRoom_0.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_0.text: You think you're free? Then let's tighten your chain.

PreparationRoom_40.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_40.text: *All that you've seen since the crash - all the wonders and horrors - suddenly seem inconsequential. Only one thing matters.*
PreparationRoom_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The skeleton clenches its fist, and the runes on Astarion's back begin to glow. It causes him pain, and he reacts.

PreparationRoom_31.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_31.text: *Cazador - your master, your lord, your creator. His will tightens around you once again, and it is as if you never escaped him.*

PreparationRoom_4.speaker: Astarion
PreparationRoom_4.text: You have become your own master. Deny him.

PreparationRoom_34.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_34.text: *Cazador's presence fills your mind, like blood in a blister. Once inside, it seeks a vulnerability to exploit, a weakness to latch onto.*

PreparationRoom_38.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_38.text: *And it finds nothing. You expel him from your mind as if he were an unpleasant clot in a fine vintage.*

PreparationRoom_25.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_25.text: *It's no good. You are in his domain, and he will not be denied. His presence fills your mind, erasing your personality.*

PreparationRoom_30.speaker: Astarion
PreparationRoom_30.text: Feign obedience and acceptance while you seek a means to fight back.

PreparationRoom_37.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_37.text: *Like blood in a blister, Cazador's presence fills your mind. You accept it, bow to it, allow it to wash over you in a red tide.*

PreparationRoom_28.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_28.text: *And as it threatens to consume you completely, you swallow it down, and reject it as if it were an unpleasant clot in a fine vintage.*

PreparationRoom_23.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_23.text: *And then it is inside you, clogging your nostrils and throat with a sickening sweetness. You cannot fight back. You cannot reject it.*

PreparationRoom_9.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_9.text: *But you're not alone in this fight. Your tadpole is aggressively territorial - and you are its territory.*

PreparationRoom_42.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_42.text: *It sends out a wall of telepathic force, shattering Cazador's will. His hold on you is broken once more.*

PreparationRoom_6.speaker: Astarion
PreparationRoom_6.text: Focus your mind to construct a mental fortress, and shelter within it.

PreparationRoom_19.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_19.text: *Cazador's presence rises in your mind, a towering red wave that seems capable of drowning the world.*

PreparationRoom_32.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_32.text: *But it crashes against the wall of sheer willpower you have erected, and breaks. He has no hold on you.*

PreparationRoom_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The runes on Astarion's back stop glowing, as their power fades. The skeleton's concentration is broken. It staggers backwards, and looks at you with shock - it's jaw hanging open

PreparationRoom_20.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_20.text: Impossible. You're a spawn - know your place!

PreparationRoom_10.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_10.text: *Cazador's presence rises in your mind, a towering red wave that seems capable of drowning the world.*

PreparationRoom_17.speaker: Narrator
PreparationRoom_17.text: *And it shatters your will entirely, smashing your defences and leaving you broken and gasping for air. You cannot deny him.*

PreparationRoom_22.speaker: Astarion
PreparationRoom_22.text: I'll do whatever Cazador wants - just let me go.

PreparationRoom_26.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_26.text: Yes, good. All he wants is your obedience.

PreparationRoom_24.speaker: Godey
PreparationRoom_24.text: And he wants you to die. But not yet.

RitualRoom_AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.text: My time is at hand! The age of the Vampire Ascendant is about to dawn!
RitualRoom_AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: About to ascend and become a super powerful vampire

Cells_NoAstarion_17.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_17.text: Please, go. Do whatever you have to.
Cells_NoAstarion_17.context: InternalNodeContext: OM happened, Astarion escaped the grapple without attacking the prisoner.

Cells_NoAstarion_18.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_18.text: Please, help us. We just want to be free.

Cells_NoAstarion_35.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_35.text: You haven't seen his rage. You don't know what he can do.

Cells_NoAstarion_42.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_42.text: Don't leave us. You can't leave us!

Cells_NoAstarion_47.speaker: Narrator
Cells_NoAstarion_47.text: *Hollow-eyed faces stare out of the cells. Some meet your eyes, but most look away. There's an almost physical stink of decay and neglect.*

Cells_NoAstarion_67.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_67.text: I'm a friend. Who are you?

Cells_NoAstarion_51.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_51.text: Sebastian. I'm - I was - I'm not sure. It was all so long ago.

Cells_NoAstarion_13.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_13.text: The last thing I remember, I was drinking with a pale, beautiful elf. We laughed, we kissed, we stumbled back to this palace, and then...

Cells_NoAstarion_32.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_32.text: Then it gets so dark. I woke up here. Like this.

Cells_NoAstarion_59.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_59.text: What am I? What are you?!

Cells_NoAstarion_0.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_0.text: I don't know. But I'm hungry.

Cells_NoAstarion_11.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_11.text: I've been hungry for so, so long...

Cells_NoAstarion_16.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_16.text: Please, you shouldn't be here. He'll find you. And he won't kill you.

Cells_NoAstarion_29.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_29.text: He won't ever let you die.

Cells_NoAstarion_14.speaker: Narrator
Cells_NoAstarion_14.text: *Under the grime, you can see how pale he is. You can see the hunger in his eyes - in all of their eyes. Each one is an emaciated, starving vampire spawn.*

Cells_NoAstarion_25.speaker: Narrator
Cells_NoAstarion_25.text: *More than that, you can see that each prisoner is marked with a scar - the same as one of the runes from Astarion's back.*

Cells_NoAstarion_55.speaker: Narrator
Cells_NoAstarion_55.text: *More than that, you can see that each prisoner is marked with a scar - a rune carved into their flesh.*

Cells_NoAstarion_50.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_50.text: That scar on your face - what does it mean?

Cells_NoAstarion_23.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_23.text: He carved it himself - said it bound me to his ascension.

Cells_NoAstarion_54.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_54.text: I don't know what that means. I don't know what any of this means...

Cells_NoAstarion_52.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_52.text: How long has it been since you fed?

Cells_NoAstarion_27.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_27.text: He never fed us. All we've ever known is hunger.

Cells_NoAstarion_37.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_37.text: I'm going to help you. I'm going to kill Cazador.

Cells_NoAstarion_61.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_61.text: And then? What happens to us?

Cells_NoAstarion_5.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_5.text: Just tell me where to find him. I'll do the rest.

Cells_NoAstarion_9.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_9.text: But even if you can kill him - what then? What happens to us?

Cells_NoAstarion_28.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_28.text: I'll set you free - what else?

Cells_NoAstarion_1.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_1.text: Free from this nightmare? It doesn't feel possible...

Cells_NoAstarion_31.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_31.text: Whatever you do, just do it quickly. I can't go on like this...

Cells_NoAstarion_64.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_64.text: That depends on you. Can you control your hunger?

Cells_NoAstarion_38.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_38.text: I - I don't know. It's all I've ever felt...

Cells_NoAstarion_56.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_56.text: I'll try. I promise I'll try.

Cells_NoAstarion_57.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_57.text: What do you want to happen?

Cells_NoAstarion_39.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_39.text: I don't know. I just don't want to die down here. Please...

Cells_NoAstarion_41.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_41.text: I have no intention of freeing a bunch of ravenous spawn.

Cells_NoAstarion_40.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_40.text: No - no, you can't leave us here. Not now - not like this!

Cells_NoAstarion_10.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_10.text: How do I open your cell? Does he have the key?

Cells_NoAstarion_22.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_22.text: His staff - it controls everything down here.

Cells_NoAstarion_63.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_63.text: But he never sets it down - you'll never get it.

Cells_NoAstarion_36.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_36.text: His staff - it controls everything down here.

Cells_NoAstarion_15.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_15.text: You can't stop him. No one can stop him.

Cells_NoAstarion_46.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_46.text: The elf that brought you here - what was his name?

Cells_NoAstarion_33.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_33.text: He called me so many sweet things. My name sounded like music on his tongue.

Cells_NoAstarion_24.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_24.text: How did this happen to you?

Cells_NoAstarion_34.speaker: Player
Cells_NoAstarion_34.text: Where are the keys to your cells?

Cells_NoAstarion_62.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_62.text: He'll find you, you know. And he won't kill you.

Cells_NoAstarion_48.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_48.text: Please, no more. I can't take any more.
Cells_NoAstarion_48.context: NodeContext: Broken by trauma and fear

Cells_NoAstarion_53.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_53.context: InternalNodeContext: OM happened, prisoner pissed at AstarionNodeContext: Small voice, lost in his own head, still cursing Astarion

Cells_NoAstarion_66.speaker: Sebastian
Cells_NoAstarion_66.text: I just want to breathe free air one last time...

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_0.text: Perhaps I should have kept Cazador's skull. Pity.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_1.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_1.text: 'Velioth'? Cazador never spoke about his former master.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_4.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_4.text: Maybe I shouldn't be surprised, given how things ended.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_3.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_3.text: A spawn rises up to kill their master - a tale as old as time, it seems.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_2.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_2.text: Suddenly not having any spawn of my own sounds wonderful.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_5.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsSkullComment_5.text: He stole everything, even his precious rules.

Cells_Child_004_0.speaker: Misha
Cells_Child_004_0.text: This place is full of monsters like you. But my family will come - they'll save us.

Cells_Child_004_1.speaker: Misha
Cells_Child_004_1.text: They'll be here soon. They'll come for us.

RitualRoom_PAD_AstarionTalksToCazador_00.speaker: Astarion
RitualRoom_PAD_AstarionTalksToCazador_00.text: You're going to suffer for everything you did to me.

Servant_001_AD_0.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_0.text: I cannot hear your voice, master. Please, answer me!
Servant_001_AD_0.context: NodeContext: Servant is trying to come to terms with his master being dead.

Servant_001_AD_1.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_1.text: Would new master be generous? Would he give us the gift?

Servant_001_AD_2.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_2.text: The master is not gone. The master cannot be gone.
Servant_001_AD_2.context: NodeContext: Servant is trying to come to terms with his master being dead.

Servant_001_AD_3.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_3.text: Tonight he ascends. Tonight we shall see his true form.

Servant_001_AD_4.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_4.text: Bless us, master. May we be worthy of you.

Servant_001_AD_5.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_5.text: Do we have a new master? A more powerful master?

Servant_001_AD_6.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_6.text: There is so much to do. So much to prepare.

Servant_001_AD_7.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_7.text: Old master is gone. Maybe a new master rises...

Servant_001_AD_8.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_8.text: Everything must be clean. Everything must be perfect.

Servant_001_AD_9.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_9.text: Everything must be clean. Then new master will see our worth.

Servant_001_AD_10.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_10.context: NodeContext: Servant is trying to come to terms with his master being dead.

Servant_001_AD_11.speaker: Vilhelm
Servant_001_AD_11.text: He will return.  He always returns.
Servant_001_AD_11.context: NodeContext: Servant is trying to come to terms with his master being dead.

GuardTower_Rat_002_SwA_1.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_002_SwA_1.text: Another guest! YES, YES! More bones to chew. MORE BODIES TO NIBBLE.
GuardTower_Rat_002_SwA_1.context: NodeContext: delighted at the thought of player dying

GuardTower_Rat_002_SwA_2.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_002_SwA_2.text: Sometimes the guests here start to bite back.

RitualRoom_AD_RitualCompleted_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_RitualCompleted_Combat_0.text: It is done - I've never felt so powerful. I've never felt so alive!

GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_Fleeing_0.speaker: Reklan
GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_Fleeing_0.text: How long have I been here? Gods, my husband will be so worried.
GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_Fleeing_0.context: NodeContext: waking up from mind control

GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_Fleeing_1.speaker: Reklan
GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_Fleeing_1.text: What am I doing? This isn't my fight.
GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_Fleeing_1.context: NodeContext: wakes up from mind control in the middle of combat

GuardTower_Trespassing_0.speaker: Reklan, Jaryd
GuardTower_Trespassing_0.text: Stop! You cannot be here. Not tonight.

GuardTower_Trespassing_1.speaker: Reklan, Jaryd
GuardTower_Trespassing_1.text: It is his command. None shall enter. None shall disturb him. Those that try will be destroyed.

Servant_003_0.speaker: Varderola
Servant_003_0.text: The master is dead. Dead. I feel lost. Who am I if master is dead?

Servant_003_1.speaker: Varderola
Servant_003_1.text: The master is pure. His palace must be pure. No stain. No smudge. No taint. Pure.

Servant_003_2.speaker: Varderola
Servant_003_2.text: Have you heard? There is a new master. He is beautiful but harsh, as we deserve.

Servant_003_3.speaker: Varderola
Servant_003_3.text: I scrub for the master. As you see. Tell the master I scrub for him. Always.

GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_CryForHelp_0.speaker: Jaryd
GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_CryForHelp_0.text: No one may enter. The master forbids it!

Cells_AD_GurChildren_6.speaker: Vanja
Cells_AD_GurChildren_6.text: But I'm really hungry. It hurts.
Cells_AD_GurChildren_6.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'really'. He's never felt hunger like this before.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_5.speaker: Chessa
Cells_AD_GurChildren_5.text: I know. Just - just try to hold on, all right? My father will come soon.
Cells_AD_GurChildren_5.context: NodeContext: Feels powerless to help her brother, but trying to keep his spirits up.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_3.speaker: Vanja
Cells_AD_GurChildren_3.text: I don't feel good. Everything just feels... wrong.
Cells_AD_GurChildren_3.context: NodeContext: Feels ill because he's been turned to a vampire spawn

Cells_AD_GurChildren_16.speaker: Chessa
Cells_AD_GurChildren_16.text: Shhh, it's all right. Our parents will come for us.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_14.speaker: Chessa
Cells_AD_GurChildren_14.text: Of course I'm sure. And once we're free, we'll make those monsters pay.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_12.speaker: Andrik
Cells_AD_GurChildren_12.text: Your eyes don't look right, Chessa.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_4.speaker: Chessa
Cells_AD_GurChildren_4.text: Yours neither. They're all red and... bright.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_11.speaker: Misha
Cells_AD_GurChildren_11.text: What's wrong with us? Are we sick?

Cells_AD_GurChildren_7.speaker: Chessa
Cells_AD_GurChildren_7.text: I don't know. I hope so...

Cells_AD_GurChildren_15.speaker: Chessa
Cells_AD_GurChildren_15.text: So, what do we do when that tall freak comes back?
Cells_AD_GurChildren_15.context: InternalNodeContext: "that tall freak" = Cazador - male vampire

Cells_AD_GurChildren_8.speaker: Misha
Cells_AD_GurChildren_8.text: He opens the door, I get his legs, you get his arms, and Kass goes for the eyes.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_2.speaker: Kass
Cells_AD_GurChildren_2.text: Yeah! We'll be out of here in no time.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_10.speaker: Andrik
Cells_AD_GurChildren_10.text: Are you sure he's coming back? The others look like they've been down here a long time.

Cells_AD_GurChildren_13.speaker: Kass
Cells_AD_GurChildren_13.text: Of course he'll come back. He's got to... right?

Mansion_AD_DeadWerewolf_0.speaker: Narrator
Mansion_AD_DeadWerewolf_0.text: *Whatever killed this werewolf burned it up from the inside. Its throat and innards are more liquid than solid.*

GuardTower_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.speaker: Astarion
GuardTower_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.text: I can sneak in here. Security shouldn't be too tight, a few charmed innocents, maybe.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_20.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_20.text: Can't think... Can't get rid of his voice...

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_22.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_22.text: My head is spinning. I can't believe you did this. What's going to happen to us ...are you going to end us like you ended Cazador?

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_8.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_8.text: We are... free? But where will we go? How will we feed?

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_23.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_23.text: Then we will go. Not to the surface, we have hunted and been hunted there too long.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_3.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_3.text: But the Underdark? Perhaps there is a home for us there.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_6.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_6.text: Thank you. You will not see us again.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_14.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_14.text: You can go wherever you want, as long as you don't harm the innocent.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_1.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_1.text: I didn't think about that. I'm afraid I can't let you go after all.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_5.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_5.text: No wait! We will leave this place, this city. You will never see us again.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_12.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_12.text: We will descend into the Underdark. We will find a place of our own, as your people once did.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_15.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_15.text: We will find a home. And we will kill anyone in our way.
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_15.context: NodeContext: About to fight with the player

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_9.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_9.text: This time I'll fight for my freedom. I'm not going down that easily!
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_9.context: NodeContext: About to fight with the player

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_19.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_19.text: Be a wolf among sheep. Travel from peaceful village to peaceful village.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_17.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_17.text: You're right. That's good advice. Thank you.

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_4.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_4.text: That depends. What will you do if I let you go?

RitualRoom_Spawn_001_11.speaker: Leon
RitualRoom_Spawn_001_11.text: I don't know. We'll need a place to feed. Where can we go?

Bedrooms_PAD_DeadGirlsDoor_0.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_PAD_DeadGirlsDoor_0.text: The door's covered in - well, some sort of magic.

Bedrooms_PAD_DeadGirlsDoor_1.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_PAD_DeadGirlsDoor_1.text: That door is saturated with necrotic magic. Best keep my distance.

Cells_Prisoner_003_0.speaker: Narrator
Cells_Prisoner_003_0.text: *He stands silently, staring intently at nothing.*

Cells_Prisoner_003_1.speaker: Gondlemead
Cells_Prisoner_003_1.text: Days. Months. Years. They're all the same...

Crypt_Skull_13.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_13.text: *The skull waits, patiently. It has but one purpose - for you to witness its memories.*

Crypt_Skull_6.speaker: Player
Crypt_Skull_6.text: The skull's memories rise and unfold. Let them wash over you.

Crypt_Skull_11.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_11.text: *This skull is all that remains of the vampire Vellioth. He turned Cazador, gave him the gift, and then taught him the rules of vampiric existence.*

Crypt_Skull_31.speaker: Player
Crypt_Skull_31.text: Concentrate on the memory. What is Vellioth's first lesson?

Crypt_Skull_5.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_5.text: *Vellioth's first lesson is always to dominate. Allow none to be your equal.*

Crypt_Skull_15.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_15.text: *Vellioth recalls when Cazador reached out to a former friend. His punishment was to watch as Vellioth drained his friend dry.*

Crypt_Skull_20.speaker: Player
Crypt_Skull_20.text: Concentrate on the memory: What is Vellioth's second lesson?

Crypt_Skull_19.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_19.text: *Vellioth's second lesson is that power comes from solitude. To share with others is to be weak, and to be weak is to fail... and die.*

Crypt_Skull_25.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_25.text: *You are distracted by an errant thought and lose the thread of Vellioth's lesson.*

Crypt_Skull_16.speaker: Player
Crypt_Skull_16.text: Move ahead to the third memory fragment.

Crypt_Skull_17.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_17.text: *Vellioth recalls when Cazador rebelled against him. Cazador suffered eleven years of impalement... because he failed.*

Crypt_Skull_14.speaker: Player
Crypt_Skull_14.text: Concentrate on the memory. What is Vellioth's third lesson?

Crypt_Skull_1.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_1.text: *Vellioth's third lesson is to act not in haste. A near immortal has time to plan, time to act only when others will pay the price of action.*

Crypt_Skull_2.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_2.text: *Vellioth recalls Cazador, his lessons learned, killing him in the Rite of Perfect Slaughter. How they both laughed!*

Crypt_Skull_23.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_23.text: *Vellioth recalls Cazador boiling the flesh from his skull and then, to mock him, clamping his Schooling Scroll in Vellioth's jaws.*

Crypt_Skull_7.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_7.text: *The skull's eyes flash a final time and its jaws sag open. The scroll with all of Cazador's rituals is yours. Vellioth is no more.*

Crypt_Skull_8.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_8.text: *You let the shock of impalement allow your focus to waver, and Vellioth's words drift away, lost in the mists of time.*

Crypt_Skull_3.speaker: Player
Crypt_Skull_3.text: Move ahead to the fourth memory fragment.

Crypt_Skull_22.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_22.text: *Your attention wanders for a moment and you miss the import of Vellioth's ghostly whisper.*

Crypt_Skull_28.speaker: Player
Crypt_Skull_28.text: Move ahead to the second memory fragment.

Crypt_Skull_26.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_26.text: *On the pillow rests a skull with a scroll clamped in its bony jaws.*

Crypt_Skull_9.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_9.text: *The skull's empty eye sockets flare with an eldritch gleam.*

Crypt_Skull_27.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_27.text: *You feel invited, somehow, to witness the skull's memories. It seems... urgent.*

Crypt_Skull_30.speaker: Narrator
Crypt_Skull_30.text: *The skull says nothing. Perhaps it rests at long last.*

RitualRoom_AD_RitualFailure_Cazador_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_RitualFailure_Cazador_0.text: No! All my work, all my toil - ruined by you.
RitualRoom_AD_RitualFailure_Cazador_0.context: NodeContext: The player's just killed someone you needed to complete the Black Mass Ritual, meaning you can't ascend to become a vampire lord

Cells_Child_005_0.speaker: Andrik
Cells_Child_005_0.text: I feel cold. I've never felt so cold.

GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_CryForHelp_0.speaker: Reklan
GuardTower_Guard_003_AD_CryForHelp_0.text: To arms! They must not interrupt our sacred night.

Bedrooms_PAD_DamagedBySinisterEnergy_0.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_PAD_DamagedBySinisterEnergy_0.text: I feel so weak. There's necrotic magic at work here.

Bedrooms_PAD_DamagedBySinisterEnergy_1.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_PAD_DamagedBySinisterEnergy_1.text: What in the hells happened? I feel so weak...

Ballroom_MainDoor_3.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_3.text: *The door is covered in intricate text, but you can't see anywhere a key might fit - only a small, round hollow engraved with a family crest.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_9.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_9.text: *Looking closer, you recognise the writing - it's the same Kozakuran script from the dictionary you found.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_27.speaker: Player
Ballroom_MainDoor_27.text: Press the Szarr signet ring against the hollow and read the door's inscription aloud.

Ballroom_MainDoor_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans forward and is implied to press a ring into a small indentation in the door. (This does not need to be shown - only implied)InternalNodeContext: Same animation as the cinematic node in LOW_CazadorsPalace_EntranceHall_RitualRoomDoor

Ballroom_MainDoor_20.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_20.text: *The ring slots perfectly into place and the door swings open.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_1.speaker: Player
Ballroom_MainDoor_1.text: Press the Szarr signet ring against the hollow in the door.

Ballroom_MainDoor_15.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_15.text: *The ring slots perfectly into place, but nothing happens. However, you get a... feeling from the door, as if it expects something else.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_23.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_23.text: *The strange writing on the door glints in the candlelight. Perhaps it's significant.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_30.speaker: Player
Ballroom_MainDoor_30.text: Read the inscription aloud, recalling what you learned from the Kozakuran book.

Ballroom_MainDoor_13.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_13.text: *Your voice echoes in the chamber, but nothing happens. The door remains resolutely shut.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_19.speaker: Player
Ballroom_MainDoor_19.text: Try to decipher the text on the door.

Ballroom_MainDoor_5.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_5.text: *It's written in archaic Kozakuran - a rare version of an already-obscure language.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_0.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_0.text: *The palace is full of inscriptions like this. Cazador always forbade you from learning the language, but you have picked up a few words.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_24.speaker: Astarion
Ballroom_MainDoor_24.text: There are inscriptions like this all over the palace. Cazador strictly forbade us from learning the language.

Ballroom_MainDoor_31.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_31.text: *You can make out enough to recognise an incantation, but the specifics elude you.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_17.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_17.text: *You can tell you're missing something, though - you spot a reference to 'the family signet'.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_29.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_29.text: *The writing means nothing to you. You can't even recognise the script.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_12.speaker: Astarion
Ballroom_MainDoor_12.text: There's writing like this all over the palace - some old, probably dead language of Cazador's. We were strictly forbidden from learning it.

Ballroom_MainDoor_21.speaker: Player
Ballroom_MainDoor_21.text: Examine the hollow in the door.

Ballroom_MainDoor_14.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_14.text: *The indentation seems to be the right size and shape to fit a signet ring bearing the family crest.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_8.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_8.text: *Only a few people wear such a ring. Cazador and Godey, your old kennel master.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_32.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_32.text: *The indentation is small and features an engraving of the family crest. Beyond that, it's a perfectly normal mysterious door.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_18.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_18.text: *The door to Cazador's ballroom, where he hosted his most hedonistic nights. You've never seen it closed, let alone locked before.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_26.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_26.text: *The door is covered in intricate text, but you can't see anywhere a key might fit - only a small, round hollow engraved with the Szarr family crest.*

Ballroom_MainDoor_22.speaker: Narrator
Ballroom_MainDoor_22.text: *The door remains sealed, with naught to see but strange writing and a small hollow.*

Dormitory_PAD_AstarionComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Dormitory_PAD_AstarionComment_0.text: The dormitory. This is where the spawn were kept when we were getting neither the carrot nor the stick.

Servant_002_1.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_1.text: The master ain't gone. The master can't be gone!

Servant_002_2.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_2.text: Everything's gotta be right for the new master. Everything's gotta be perfect.

Servant_002_3.speaker: Narrator
Servant_002_3.text: *The woman's eyes are alert, verging on manic, as she bustles about.*

Servant_002_0.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_0.text: Everything's gotta be right for the master. Everything's gotta be perfect.

Servant_002_4.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_4.text: So much to do, so much to do!

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_20.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_15.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_15.text: How did you end up here?

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_23.speaker: Victoria
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_23.text: Lady promised me food... shelter... took me here...

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_17.speaker: Victoria
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_17.text: She brought me here... promised food... shelter...

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_0.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_0.text: Do you know anything about the dictionary I found?

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_1.speaker: Victoria
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_1.text: Lady who brought me here carried it... Hid it from monster...

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_16.speaker: Victoria
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_16.text: Lady carried it... Hid it from monster...

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_27.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_27.text: What lady? Do you know her name?

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_9.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_9.text: What happened when you got here?

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_26.speaker: Victoria
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_26.text: She held me... bit me... blood everywhere...

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_4.speaker: Victoria
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_4.text: Tried but... couldn't drink... retching and gagging... then monster arrived...

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_25.speaker: Victoria
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_25.text: Furious... she tried to disobey... not drink thinking creatures... he dragged her away...

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_2.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_2.text: What did the monster look like?

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_24.speaker: Narrator
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_24.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_28.speaker: Narrator
Bedrooms_DeadGirl_Dead_28.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Servant_004_0.speaker: Greenfern
Servant_004_0.text: I must be busy. Busy busy busy. Master might see me! Master might approve!

Servant_004_1.speaker: Greenfern
Servant_004_1.text: If the master is dead, then for whom do I clean? For whom do I scour and polish?

Servant_004_2.speaker: Greenfern
Servant_004_2.text: They say there's a new master. I must offer him everything. Everything.

Servant_004_3.speaker: Greenfern
Servant_004_3.text: Shh, shh. Not now. Busy busy busy.

RitualRoom_AD_ResponseToAstarion_002_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_ResponseToAstarion_002_0.text: But I've already won, my boy.

RitualRoom_AD_ResponseToAstarion_002_1.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_ResponseToAstarion_002_1.text: All the pieces are in place - the Ascension is inevitable.

RitualRoom_Spawn_003_0.speaker: Yousen
RitualRoom_Spawn_003_0.text: Am I alive? I'm alive! Ha ha ha ha ha! But oh, oh, oh, for how long?

RitualRoom_Spawn_003_1.speaker: Yousen
RitualRoom_Spawn_003_1.text: Cazador, dead. I was his slave for only 60 years, but it seems like an eternity.

RitualRoom_Spawn_003_2.speaker: Yousen
RitualRoom_Spawn_003_2.text: Agh! I feel like I gargled a straight razor. But to feel anything is wonderful - wonderful!

Bedrooms_PAD_BookAndRing_0.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_PAD_BookAndRing_0.text: It's Kozakuran - just like the symbols from that door.
Bedrooms_PAD_BookAndRing_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Didn't find the ring, but succeded on the check in the Ballroom Door dialogNodeContext: Kozakuran: [KO-za-KUR-an]

Bedrooms_PAD_BookAndRing_1.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_PAD_BookAndRing_1.text: A dictionary of an ancient language? Hardly surprising for a vampire's lair.

Bedrooms_PAD_BookAndRing_2.speaker: Player
Bedrooms_PAD_BookAndRing_2.text: I've seen this language before - inscribed on the Szarrs' signet ring, I think.

RitualRoom_AD_AttackingAstarion_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_AttackingAstarion_0.text: I will have your submission, boy. Even if it kills you.

GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_0.speaker: Jaryd
GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_0.text: His voice - it's gone! And so am I.
GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_0.context: NodeContext: waking up from mind control

GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_2.speaker: Jaryd
GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_2.text: What's going on? Why am I fighting?!
GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_2.context: NodeContext: Wakes up from being charmed

GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_1.speaker: Jaryd
GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_1.text: Oh no, to hells with this!
GuardTower_Guard_002_AD_Fleeing_1.context: NodeContext: Fleeing a combat he doesn't want to be in

Kennel_Skeleton_0.speaker: Godey
Kennel_Skeleton_0.text: Spotted me, did you? Sharp for a mortal, servant.

Kennel_Skeleton_3.speaker: Godey
Kennel_Skeleton_3.text: Wait! You are neither spawn nor servant. An intrusive mortal then. You made a mistake, little thief.

Kennel_Skeleton_1.speaker: Godey
Kennel_Skeleton_1.text: Go go, little fools! Do not keep the master waiting!

Kennel_Skeleton_2.speaker: Godey
Kennel_Skeleton_2.text: It's gone, it's gone. Master trusted Godey with his ring and it's gone!

Kennel_Skeleton_4.speaker: Godey
Kennel_Skeleton_4.text: Why are you here? Spawns and servants have been summoned below. Squeak, you rat!

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsJournalComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsJournalComment_0.text: So, he was keeping notes on me. That would have terrified me, once.

Coffin_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player opens the coffin lid to reveal Cazador lying in his coffin.

Coffin_1.speaker: Narrator
Coffin_1.text: *The vampire lord lies before you, still as death.*

Coffin_10.speaker: Cazador Szarr
Coffin_10.text: These deathless dreams hold memories of a mortal life once-forgotten. Of the boy I was, the man I became, the monster that will not end.

Coffin_9.speaker: Cazador Szarr
Coffin_9.text: I sleep, but cannot rest. I live, but cannot die. I am eternal, and I grieve.

Coffin_50.speaker: Narrator
Coffin_50.text: *His dreams have the form of an endless ocean of blood, vast and unknowable.*

Coffin_41.speaker: Cazador Szarr
Coffin_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes the ancient dagger that Cazador holds, and plunges it through his heart. He wakes on impact,  looks at the player who killed him. Speaks his final words softly, as he turns to dust.NodeContext: Latin - 'It is finished - I fall.' (kon-soom-AH-toom est - E-go che-CHEE-dee)

Coffin_47.speaker: Narrator
Coffin_47.text: *The vampire lord is no more, but his legacy remains: seven thousand vampire spawn, including the stolen children of the Gur hunters. What will you do with them all?*
Coffin_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player picks up Cazador's staff, which is lying in the now-otherwise-empty coffin.

Coffin_56.speaker: Narrator
Coffin_56.text: *The vampire lord is no more, but his legacy remains. What to do with the thousands of vampire spawn he created?*
Coffin_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player picks up Cazador's staff, which is lying in the now-otherwise-empty coffin.

Coffin_33.speaker: Player
Coffin_33.text: Use the staff to set the prisoners free.

Coffin_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds the staff before them with two hands and focuses.

Coffin_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see prison doors swinging open and vampire spawn taking their first tentative steps out of their cells.

Coffin_14.speaker: Lae'zel
Coffin_14.text: A herd of vampire spawn, unleashed on the Sword Coast. What could go wrong?

Coffin_15.speaker: Shadowheart
Coffin_15.text: I didn't realise you had such a soft streak. Now it'll cost you. And the city as well, perhaps...
Coffin_15.context: NodeContext: Disapproving (but not deeply angry - just thinks it was a bad call)

Coffin_40.speaker: Shadowheart
Coffin_40.text: You did the right thing. All those deaths would have weighed you down.

Coffin_11.speaker: Wyll
Coffin_11.text: The spawn have their freedom - but what of the city, what of the lives they take? Gods, I can't imagine...

Coffin_65.speaker: Gale
Coffin_65.text: They have their freedom... but what of the city? Have we just unleashed a plague onto the streets?

Coffin_34.speaker: Karlach
Coffin_34.text: Seven thousand vampire spawns, unleashed on the Sword Coast. It'll be a well-dressed flood of mayhem, at least.

Coffin_55.speaker: Halsin
Coffin_55.text: A wise choice. Let nature determine their fates.

Coffin_51.speaker: Jaheira
Coffin_51.text: I should applaud the liberation of bound creatures. But somehow I sense I will be the one cleaning up this mess.

Coffin_30.speaker: Minsc
Coffin_30.text: Fly, little vampires! Return to this city, and you will answer to BOO!
Coffin_30.context: NodeContext: Minsc is only now realising the gravity of letting them all free - so he leaves them with this parting threat

Coffin_54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Coffin_54.text: Liberating them may be a salve to your conscience, but it is not a kindness. The city's poorer quarters will be their feasthall.

Coffin_19.speaker: Player
Coffin_19.text: Destroy them with the staff's dark magic.

Coffin_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The prisoners in the cells scream and explode, sending a rain of blood down on us

Coffin_25.speaker: Lae'zel
Coffin_25.text: Snuffed out in an instant, but to whose satisfaction? They will never feed and never be hunted. And never have a chance to hew their own paths.

Coffin_27.speaker: Shadowheart
Coffin_27.text: Wise choice. Now the streets will be safer and you'll be stronger.

Coffin_26.speaker: Shadowheart
Coffin_26.text: All those lives, just snuffed out... I hope it was worth it.

Coffin_4.speaker: Wyll
Coffin_4.text: A merciful end. To lock them away forever would have been an unbearable agony.

Coffin_35.speaker: Narrator
Coffin_35.text: *Nothing remains now. Cazador and his machinations are naught but dust.*

Coffin_5.speaker: Gale
Coffin_5.text: So many dead... we'll never wash this blood from our hands.

Coffin_12.speaker: Karlach
Coffin_12.text: It's done. Just like that. Gods, help us.

Coffin_43.speaker: Halsin
Coffin_43.text: All those lives snuffed out, just to grasp some power. That was craven - unnatural.

Coffin_16.speaker: Jaheira
Coffin_16.text: A cold kind of mercy - but mercy still, I think.

Coffin_21.speaker: Minsc
Coffin_21.text: To end so many with only rhyming and words... the sword would have been messy, yes. But cleaner too, thinks Boo.
Coffin_21.context: NodeContext: A little shaken by the ritual 'mercy-killing' of thousands of vampire spawn he just witnessed. They were beasts, yes, but even beasts deserve a death in battle.

Coffin_37.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Coffin_37.context: NodeContext: in awe, having just watched thousands of people die at the player's command. Impressed.

Coffin_59.speaker: Player
Coffin_59.text: Destroy the staff so the vampiric prisoners can never escape.

Coffin_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player snaps the staff over their knee (or other method of destroying the staff)

Coffin_61.speaker: Lae'zel
Coffin_61.text: Eternally trapped - a damned existence all its own. Never to be predator, never to be prey.

Coffin_48.speaker: Shadowheart
Coffin_48.text: Eternal imprisonment. Would have been kinder to just kill them.

Coffin_53.speaker: Wyll
Coffin_53.text: Gods, the horror of being forever locked away. The grave would have been a more merciful fate.

Coffin_7.speaker: Gale
Coffin_7.text: Perhaps its for the best. Freeing them could have unleashed chaos, and the thought of killing them is more than I could stomach.

Coffin_60.speaker: Karlach
Coffin_60.text: This doesn't feel right. I don't know what else to do, but still...
Coffin_60.context: NodeContext: Uneasy. Torn between a bad choice and a worse choice. Sad because it reminds her of her own situation of being trapped in Hell.

Coffin_62.speaker: Halsin
Coffin_62.text: This may keep the city safe, but to seal all those unfortunates away forever...? Death would have been more merciful.

Coffin_31.speaker: Jaheira
Coffin_31.text: Entombed forever beneath the city, starving and yet unable to die. True death might have been kinder.

Coffin_13.speaker: Minsc
Coffin_13.text: If they be innocent, they deserve life. If they be not - death. This hanging about in between... it is uncommon cruel.
Coffin_13.context: NodeContext: Quietly disgruntled with our decision to keep the vampire spawn alive but imprisoned - almost pities them

Coffin_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Coffin_2.text: They will gnaw at their own flesh before long, in an effort to fight off the hunger. It would have been kinder, and less cowardly, to kill them.
Coffin_2.context: NodeContext: judgmental - player left thousands of vampire spawn imprisoned for eternity, and Minthara thinks this was cowardly and cruel. She's not sad, more annoyed with what she sees as a poor decision

Coffin_29.speaker: Narrator
Coffin_29.text: *The great vampire lord looks peaceful, recovering in his coffin. There is no trace of the fury that you fought against.*
Coffin_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: players stand around Cazador's coffin, looking down at the sleeping vampire. His hands are crossed over his chest, and a dagger is held in them

Coffin_46.speaker: Narrator
Coffin_46.text: *The coffin lies silent, containing nothing but dust and memories.*

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_0.text: Blessed are you all to witness my ascension.

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_1.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_1.text: I have worked too long on this ritual to have that brat spoil it now.

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_2.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_2.text: I will have power like no other - I will be reborn.

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_3.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_3.text: To abandon me. To abandon his family - wretched creature.

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_4.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_4.text: Astarion will return to me. Our family will be whole again.

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_5.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_5.text: I never should have spoiled the child so.

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_6.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_6.text: My dear Astarion. I knew you would return.

RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_7.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_Cazador_7.text: Our family is whole again. You will serve me once more.

Cells_Child_002_0.speaker: Kass
Cells_Child_002_0.text: You took us by surprise before. That won't ever happen again.

Cells_Child_002_1.speaker: Kass
Cells_Child_002_1.text: I should've trained harder. I should've protected the others.

Servant_002_AD_0.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_0.text: Just keep cleaning. Don't think - just keep cleaning.

Servant_002_AD_1.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_1.text: Miss a spot and he'll see it. Master sees everything.

Servant_002_AD_2.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_2.text: I'm so tired. But it'll be over soon. I can rest soon.

Servant_002_AD_3.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_3.text: What do we do without him? Can't go nowhere...

Servant_002_AD_4.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_4.text: It's gotta be clean. It's gotta be immaculate.

Servant_002_AD_5.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_5.text: Place feels so empty now. Feels so dead.

Servant_002_AD_6.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_6.text: Just keep cleaning. Don't stop cleaning.

Servant_002_AD_7.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_7.text: New master, old master. Don't matter, just keep 'em happy.

Servant_002_AD_8.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_8.text: Just when we had everything perfect, there's a brand new master.
Servant_002_AD_8.context: NodeContext: Fed up, "ugh, can you believe it?" tone.

Servant_002_AD_9.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_9.text: Master can't be gone. Master's forever!

Servant_002_AD_10.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_10.text: Will the new master be kind? Will he have rages?

Servant_002_AD_11.speaker: Syrin
Servant_002_AD_11.text: We'll have it clean soon. We'll have it perfect.

RitualRoom_Spawn_004_0.speaker: Violet
RitualRoom_Spawn_004_0.text: Cazador is dust, and Violet blooms! I shall live as a permanent rebuke to all that monster stood for!

RitualRoom_Spawn_004_1.speaker: Violet
RitualRoom_Spawn_004_1.text: Praise Kelemvor! I died a thousand times, yet somehow, I live!

RitualRoom_Spawn_004_2.speaker: Violet
RitualRoom_Spawn_004_2.text: Cazador dead, and I alive! I'm giddy, I'm giddy with glee!

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_1.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_1.text: No mumbling! No talk to rats! They only lie.
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Werewolf looking at his brother who is talking to a bunch of rats in a crazy stupor

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_2.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_2.text: Wolves will not obey? Be their alpha. Make them hear you.
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Werewolf looking at this brother werewolf who is asserting dominance over some dire wolves

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_3.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_3.text: New master keeps all the fresh meat. But not for long. Tonight he changes.
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Werewolf looking at an empty throne and imagining Cazador sitting there after the ritual.

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_0.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_003_0.text: Promises we'll have fresh meat then. All we can eat, bloody and raw.

Cells_Child_001_81.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_81.text: This doesn't feel good. I don't like this.

Cells_Child_001_117.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_117.text: Hey, you! It's you isn't it? I remember that stupid hair.

Cells_Child_001_47.speaker: Narrator
Cells_Child_001_47.text: *Behind the glowing eyes and pallid skin, you recognise the faces of the children you took from the Gur hunters' camp on Cazador's orders.*

Cells_Child_001_246.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_246.text: You better watch out, our parents will be here soon. And when they find you, they'll - urgh.

Cells_Child_001_8.speaker: Narrator
Cells_Child_001_8.text: *You know that pain well. She's feeling the same hunger that's plagued you for two hundred years.*

Cells_Child_001_155.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_155.text: What? What are you looking at?

Cells_Child_001_102.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_102.text: Your parents aren't coming. But I am. I'm here to save you.

Cells_Child_001_18.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_18.text: I never thought you'd end up like this. I'm so sorry.

Cells_Child_001_49.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_49.text: What? You expect me to believe that?

Cells_Child_001_185.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_185.text: You're the one that did this to us. You're the one that took us, and offered us up to be Cazador's spawns.

Cells_Child_001_79.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_79.text: And now I'm here to make amends.

Cells_Child_001_53.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_53.text: Amends? You think you can amend this?

Cells_Child_001_28.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_28.text: We were supposed to be hunters. We spent our whole lives training, studying... You were the one we were supposed to kill!

Cells_Child_001_68.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_68.text: Now we're no better than you. Worse. At least you get to roam free.

Cells_Child_001_200.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_200.text: I'm actually here to free you.

Cells_Child_001_142.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_142.text: You want sympathy because you can't hunt me like your parents did?

Cells_Child_001_232.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_232.text: My parents... I wonder how they're doing...

Cells_Child_001_226.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_226.text: You can tell them yourself when I free you.

Cells_Child_001_37.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_37.text: Don't think about it - that life is behind you now.

Cells_Child_001_71.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_71.text: We thought we'd figured it out at first - we could just stake ourselves with sharp twigs from the gutter and be done with it. But - it's harder than it looks.

Cells_Child_001_38.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_38.text: Even when we managed it, all it did was paralyse us. We tried twice each, just to be sure.

Cells_Child_001_242.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_242.text: Simple. I save your lives, your parents stop hunting me.

Cells_Child_001_136.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_136.text: Self-preservation - that actually makes sense. If you'd said anything else, I'd have struggled to believe you.

Cells_Child_001_62.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_62.text: That's rubbish, and you know it! My parents would never stop hunting you.

Cells_Child_001_84.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_84.text: You're a monster. The worst kind. And you need to leave.

Cells_Child_001_97.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_97.text: I can't bear to see you suffering like this because of something I did.

Cells_Child_001_133.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_133.text: So what are you waiting for? Let us out!

Cells_Child_001_111.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_111.text: All right, I'll free you once I have the staff.

Cells_Child_001_249.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_249.text: I'll free you once I have Cazador's staff.

Cells_Child_001_126.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_126.text: I need to find the key to your cell first. Do you know where it is?

Cells_Child_001_217.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_217.text: Changed my mind. Maybe you should wait here until your parents arrive.

Cells_Child_001_36.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_36.text: You RAT! You raised our hopes just to kill them. You're worse than Cazador!

Cells_Child_001_70.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_70.text: Uh huh. Sure, first you kidnap us and then you want to save us. That makes sense.

Cells_Child_001_192.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_192.text: I'm not going to let Cazador take advantage of you like he took advantage of me.

Cells_Child_001_206.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_206.text: Because you're vampire spawn. You should be out in the world feasting, not locked in a dungeon!

Cells_Child_001_11.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_11.text: That's... one way of looking at it.

Cells_Child_001_76.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_76.text: Good point. There's no reason to free you. It's safer for everyone if you stay right where you are.

Cells_Child_001_25.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_25.text: It wouldn't solve anything, anyway. Not for your parents, not for you.

Cells_Child_001_119.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_119.text: Then what are we supposed to do?

Cells_Child_001_115.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_115.text: Hey, come back! Don't leave us here!

Cells_Child_001_56.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_56.text: Better off without you, I'd imagine, given what you've become.

Cells_Child_001_173.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_173.text: You could have just left us here to starve, you know. You didn't have to come and insult us. Arsehole.

Cells_Child_001_240.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_240.text: Quit whining. You're a vampire spawn now. That's much better than being human.

Cells_Child_001_197.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_197.text: But still not strong enough to get out of this place. Or away from Cazador.

Cells_Child_001_61.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_61.text: I wouldn't know would I? I've never been a human.

Cells_Child_001_46.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_46.text: Perhaps that's why you don't understand. You've never known what it truly means to be free. To be tracking prey in the wild...

Cells_Child_001_24.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_24.text: That's not a good thing. That was going to be our way out of this.

Cells_Child_001_101.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_101.text: As long as we're here, as long as Cazador's alive, we're - stuck.

Cells_Child_001_63.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_63.text: And roam free, I shall. Goodbye.

Cells_Child_001_169.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_169.text: Isn't it wonderful? A vast improvement.

Cells_Child_001_214.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_214.text: I regret it. I regret everything.

Cells_Child_001_50.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_50.text: If you're a spawn, then you understand how hard it is to resist Cazador's requests.

Cells_Child_001_237.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_237.text: But did you have to kidnap us?

Cells_Child_001_65.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_65.text: It hurts, doesn't it? The hunger.

Cells_Child_001_98.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_98.context: NodeContext: Seing kids he once kidnapped.

Cells_Child_001_215.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_215.text: It is you. I knew it!

Cells_Child_001_184.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_184.text: I'll kill you! Once I get out of here I'LL KILL YOU!

Cells_Child_001_41.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_41.text: You're the children from the monster hunter's camp?

Cells_Child_001_248.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_248.text: Camp... monster hunters... the Gur camp? Oh gods - my parents' camp!

Cells_Child_001_14.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_14.text: Chessa, focus. Resist the beast inside you. You promised!
Cells_Child_001_14.context: NodeContext: chastising herself in horror for forgetting about her parents now that the vampiric instinct has taken hold of her

Cells_Child_001_194.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_194.text: It's your fault. You did this to us.

Cells_Child_001_42.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_42.text: Didn't he tell you? He's the one that kidnapped us. He's the reason we're spawns. I'LL KILL YOU.
Cells_Child_001_42.context: NodeContext: Talking to player about Astarion. Last line directed at Astarion.

Cells_Child_001_43.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_43.text: Ah. Ah-hah... yes, now that you mention it, I may have done... that.

Cells_Child_001_73.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_73.text: Don't look at me like that - Cazador's orders.

Cells_Child_001_2.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_2.text: Quite the deviation from my usual routine, of course. Capture, not lure. I didn't bring them in with sweetrolls or anything.

Cells_Child_001_64.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_64.text: I really forgot about them, felt nothing the moment I handed them over to him.

Cells_Child_001_40.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_40.text: We promised their parents we'd save them.

Cells_Child_001_75.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_75.context: NodeContext: sad, coming back to herself, remembering a lost life

Cells_Child_001_221.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_221.text: I miss them. I think. Or perhaps it's the hunger... oh I don't know. It's so hard to tell!
Cells_Child_001_221.context: NodeContext: sentimental, but also confused, frustrated

Cells_Child_001_110.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_110.text: They'll be fine, so long as we free you from this place.

Cells_Child_001_104.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_104.text: I don't think I'll ever be able to go home. Not like this.

Cells_Child_001_174.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_174.text: You should go. Leave us here. We shouldn't be out there. We'd hurt our families.

Cells_Child_001_89.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_89.text: I'm going to help you. How do I free you?

Cells_Child_001_21.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_21.context: NodeContext: a moment of pause, and shifting from anger to hope

Cells_Child_001_168.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_168.text: I can't promise anything, but I'll try.

Cells_Child_001_127.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_127.text: What are you doing? They're going to tear me to shreds... They'd never forgive me for what I've done.

Cells_Child_001_87.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_87.text: Deep down somewhere, they're just kids who need our help.

Cells_Child_001_205.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_205.text: I was in the prime of my life when I was turned.

Cells_Child_001_239.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_239.text: Everything was taken from me, too.

Cells_Child_001_120.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_120.text: Of course I deserve it, but the countless others they'd feed from...

Cells_Child_001_121.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_121.text: You're making excuses. You just want to bury your sins.

Cells_Child_001_57.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_57.text: Feeding is not the same as killing. They can come back from the brink.

Cells_Child_001_211.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_211.text: I just... I never want to see these little scraps of misery again. The world doesn't need to know my shame.

Cells_Child_001_105.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_105.text: You're not honestly asking me to sacrifice them, are you?

Cells_Child_001_150.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_150.text: Maybe I am. Maybe that's what I have to do.

Cells_Child_001_158.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_158.text: Well, what else would you have me do?

Cells_Child_001_245.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_245.text: I've changed my mind. I think it's safer you stay right where you are.

Cells_Child_001_67.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_67.text: Might I recommend acquiring a taste for rats? They won't sate your appetite, but they help with the hunger.

Cells_Child_001_12.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_12.text: Rats. Great idea. Why didn't I think of that? I'll just find the hundred rats I'd need to even make a dent in this hunger.

Cells_Child_001_178.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_178.text: Never give up hope. Trust me, I know what I'm talking about.

Cells_Child_001_172.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_172.text: I'm sorry it had to end this way. Good luck to you.

Cells_Child_001_227.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_227.text: Tell them... tell them you couldn't find us.
Cells_Child_001_227.context: NodeContext: First line, trying to think of something nice to say. Second line, realising that's the only nice thing you could possibly say to save her parents from pain.

Cells_Child_001_83.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_83.text: The world will be a safer place with you behind bars.

Cells_Child_001_238.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_238.text: Better off without you, now that I've seen what you've become.

Cells_Child_001_175.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_175.text: I couldn't have put it less delicately if I'd tried.

Cells_Child_001_106.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_106.text: We need to get these children out of here.

Cells_Child_001_216.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_216.text: We're not children! Don't call us children! We'll drink you dry.
