Cells_Child_001_216.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

Cells_Child_001_32.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_32.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

Cells_Child_001_183.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_183.text: Cool it. I'll help you. But you need to tell us how to free you.

Cells_Child_001_203.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_203.text: You are definitely exactly where you belong. Safely locked away from the rest of us.

Cells_Child_001_140.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_140.text: I hope Cazador finds you and drains you to a husk.

Cells_Child_001_124.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_124.text: If we eliminate Cazador, will they be free?

Cells_Child_001_141.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_141.text: I suppose there's a good chance they will.

Cells_Child_001_54.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_54.text: What use is it, though? They're lost, ravenous, feral. They'd attack any mortal on sight.

Cells_Child_001_186.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_186.text: All these people were ruined because of me.

Cells_Child_001_35.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_35.text: If Cazador wants them, then Cazador can have them. Let's go.

Cells_Child_001_244.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_244.text: I hope he finds you and drains you to a husk.
Cells_Child_001_244.context: NodeContext: Italics spoken with psychopathic, vampire fury and hunger.

Cells_Child_001_91.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_91.text: Well that could have gone better.

Cells_Child_001_251.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_251.text: Astarion, why do these children know you?

Cells_Child_001_128.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_128.text: I don't know what you mean. I've never seen these children in my life.

Cells_Child_001_218.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_218.text: LIAR! You're the one who kidnapped us! You're the reason we're spawns! I'LL KILL YOU.

Cells_Child_001_15.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_15.text: And it's all because of him.

Cells_Child_001_17.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_17.text: You'll do nothing of the sort. Astarion's with me.

Cells_Child_001_22.speaker: Astarion
Cells_Child_001_22.text: How chivalrous of you. As if I need defending from these children.

Cells_Child_001_130.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_130.text: If I ever get out of here, you'll wish you'd DIED when you were bitten!

Cells_Child_001_170.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_170.text: Smells fresh. Smells alive. Smells like... NO. Chessa, stop it. This isn't you!
Cells_Child_001_170.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffing the air. NodeContext: Getting hungry, italics spoken like a psychopath succumbing to vampiric hunger. Then suddenly realising what they're saying, pulling back and mortified with themselves.

Cells_Child_001_34.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_34.text: Are you the kids from the Gur camp?

Cells_Child_001_131.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_131.text: The Gur camp, the Gur camp... Maybe? Yes. I think so.
Cells_Child_001_131.context: NodeContext: The Gur camp is precisely where they're from, but they've half-forgotten now that they're vampire spawn. She's thinking about it, and it stirs a memory, but it's foggy.

Cells_Child_001_235.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_235.text: I don't like the way you're talking about me.

Cells_Child_001_88.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_88.text: I don't like it any more than you do... but I'm hungry. Starved.

Cells_Child_001_233.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_233.text: And you look a tasty treat... No, Chessa, NO. Gods, if I could only think, but this hunger...
Cells_Child_001_233.context: NodeContext: psychopathically cold, succumbing for a moment to vampiric instincts

Cells_Child_001_123.speaker: Narrator
Cells_Child_001_123.text: *This is no ordinary hunger. This is the hunger of a vampire spawn. One that hasn't fed since it was created.*

Cells_Child_001_208.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_208.text: It's that obvious, is it? Urgh. Then there's no hope for us, even if we got out of here.
Cells_Child_001_208.context: NodeContext: dejected, whatever sliver of denial she was hanging onto is now gone

Cells_Child_001_0.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_0.text: Because there's nothing to eat. Nothing I want to eat.

Cells_Child_001_113.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_113.text: Except you. Chessa, STOP. I'm sorry.
Cells_Child_001_113.context: NodeContext: hungrily, giving into monstrous vampiric instincts, then catching herself and pulling back

Cells_Child_001_204.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_204.context: NodeContext: horrified by her own monstrosity

Cells_Child_001_148.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_148.text: You know him? Then you understand...

Cells_Child_001_135.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_135.text: His servant kidnapped us. The pretty one with the frilly clothes and white hair. One moment we're at camp. Then, the world goes dark.

Cells_Child_001_139.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_139.text: The next thing I remember, there's someone breathing on my neck, a tongue, and then the pain...

Cells_Child_001_241.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_241.text: All the monsters I ever met were in books. I never even made it to the adult hunt. But now I'm one of them. I'm a spawn.
Cells_Child_001_241.context: NodeContext: on the verge of tears as they're reminiscing and realising what they've become

Cells_Child_001_159.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_159.text: Please, if you've any mercy, put us down like the prey we are.

Cells_Child_001_95.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_95.text: I'm here to free you. Not kill you.

Cells_Child_001_222.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_222.text: NO! No... you can't. You mustn't.

Cells_Child_001_143.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_143.text: I'll drink you dry as a desert.
Cells_Child_001_143.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, frightening switch to a calm, cool, psychopathic vampiric instinct. Genuine evil.

Cells_Child_001_234.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_234.text: I'm sorry. It's the hunger... If you were to free us... there's no knowing what we'll do.

Cells_Child_001_13.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_13.text: Never give up hope. Trust me, I know what I'm talking about.

Cells_Child_001_144.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_144.text: Perhaps if Cazador's dead, you'll be truly free.

Cells_Child_001_3.speaker: Narrator
Cells_Child_001_3.text: *Behind the exhaustion, starvation, and fear - recognition stirs in her eyes, and with it - hope.*

Cells_Child_001_94.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_94.text: That's... true. The books said so. 'The spawn are only bound so long as their lord lives.'

Cells_Child_001_255.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_255.text: Cazador's got this staff - it controls the doors. If you get it, you can set everyone free. If you get it... somehow...

Cells_Child_001_189.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_189.text: I'll take my chances. How do I release you?

Cells_Child_001_69.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_69.text: All right, I'll free you once I have the staff.

Cells_Child_001_145.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_145.text: Good luck. If you fail, well - I suppose we'll be seeing you again in here.

Cells_Child_001_30.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_30.text: Well, I hope your parents come and visit you.

Cells_Child_001_162.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_162.text: I hope they don't. I hope they stay well away from here.

Cells_Child_001_207.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_207.text: I'm not going to kill you. I'm going to free you.

Cells_Child_001_253.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_253.text: I'm not about to kill a child.

Cells_Child_001_96.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_96.text: I'm not a child. I'm EVIL. I'm an evil monster!
Cells_Child_001_96.context: NodeContext: A child trying to convince us she's really bad.

Cells_Child_001_6.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_6.text: I'm sorry. It's the hunger... It's worse than anything I've ever known... No matter what I do, it just doesn't stop.
Cells_Child_001_6.context: NodeContext: catches herself, and abruptly switches back to apologetic child

Cells_Child_001_7.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_7.text: What if I free you? Will that help?

Cells_Child_001_166.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_166.text: Did you not hear me? We're vampire spawn. And we're hungry. We'll be a risk to everything and everyone we meet!

Cells_Child_001_66.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_66.text: I'm here to kill Cazador. Perhaps once I do, the hunger will be over too.

Cells_Child_001_23.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_23.text: It's a prison. There must be plenty of rats for you to eat?

Cells_Child_001_177.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_177.text: Have you ever tried eating a rat? Stale as mouldy bread, their blood.

Cells_Child_001_108.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_108.text: But yours... is off-limits! Off-limits, Chessa!
Cells_Child_001_108.context: NodeContext: 'But yours...' referring to player's blood with hunger, before catching herself and chastising herself again for slipping into animalistic vampire instincts

Cells_Child_001_1.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_1.text: I think you're in the best place you could possibly be - safely behind bars.

Cells_Child_001_250.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_250.text: Now please leave. You're making me hungry.

Cells_Child_001_99.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_99.text: It won't make a difference. You're already dead.

Cells_Child_001_103.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_103.text: If you're Cazador's spawn, I'll let him do with you as he wishes.

Cells_Child_001_179.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_179.text: Please. Go away now. You're making the hunger worse.

Cells_Child_001_5.speaker: Player
Cells_Child_001_5.text: Let me get you out of there, and you can find something to eat.

Cells_Child_001_228.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_228.text: NO! Please - you can't. Not like this. Our families can't see what we've become. What Cazador turned us into.

Cells_Child_001_157.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_157.text: Leave us alone! You've done enough, freak.

Cells_Child_001_209.speaker: Chessa
Cells_Child_001_209.text: I wish I could see my father again.

GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_CryForHelp_0.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_CryForHelp_0.text: Intruders! The master must not be disturbed!

RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_0.text: Blessed are you all to witness this day. To witness my ascension!

RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_1.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_1.text: Our lost son may have delayed us, but he cannot stop the inevitable.

RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_2.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_2.text: Centuries of work, all building to this. I can all but taste the power.

RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_3.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_CazadorBeforeRitual_3.text: Can you feel them? Seven thousand souls, just waiting to be collected.

ElevatorDown_7.speaker: Narrator
ElevatorDown_7.text: *In all your years living in the palace, this is the first time you've ever seen this antiquated elevator.*

ElevatorDown_2.speaker: Narrator
ElevatorDown_2.text: *This was Cazador's private wing - no one was ever permitted in here but him. And the poor souls you brought him to feed on.*

ElevatorDown_4.speaker: Narrator
ElevatorDown_4.text: *There are some scuffs to show its age, signs of things dragged onto it over the years, but it seems to be in good working order.*

ElevatorDown_11.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorDown_11.text: What in the hells? I never knew this was here. This was always Cazador's private quarters - only he ever came in here.

ElevatorDown_9.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorDown_9.text: Well, him and the unfortunate souls we brought to feed him.

ElevatorDown_8.speaker: Narrator
ElevatorDown_8.text: *Standing on the elevator's platform, you can feel a cold draught from below.*

ElevatorDown_12.speaker: Player
ElevatorDown_12.text: Descend into the depths of the palace.

RitualRoom_AD_CazadorRitualSuccess_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_CazadorRitualSuccess_0.text: Centuries of toil, all building to this.

RitualRoom_AD_CazadorRitualSuccess_1.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_CazadorRitualSuccess_1.text: The power is phenomenal. I feel so alive!

RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_2P_0.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_2P_0.text: Those runes are leeching the spawns' power and sending it straight to Cazador.

RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_2P_1.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_2P_1.text: If we can reach the glowing sigils, maybe we can redirect that power from him to us.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_1.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_1.text: Factions, nobles, politicians - he had information on everyone. If he'd ascended, the city would have been his in a tenday.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_2.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_2.text: Details of who pulls every string in Baldur's Gate. Just what a powerful vampire needs to make this city his puppet.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_0.text: Thank you, my dearly-departed master. I'll put it to good use.

Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_3.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_CazadorsPlansComment_3.text: Guilds, nobles, politicians - if he controlled even a fraction of these, the city could be his and no one would ever know.

Mansion_AD_RunemasterBust_1.speaker: Narrator
Mansion_AD_RunemasterBust_1.text: *The inscription on this bust reads 'Shyressa Runemaster'. Whoever that was.*

GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_0.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_0.text: All I remember is wanting to serve him. Just being desperate to serve him.
GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_0.context: NodeContext: waking up from mind control

GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_1.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_1.text: Gods, I need to go. I need to get home.

GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_2.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_2.text: I'm so confused. I'm so lost.
GuardTower_Guard_001_AD_Fleeing_2.context: NodeContext: waking up from mind control in the middle of combat

Cells_Prisoner_004_0.speaker: Hapdim
Cells_Prisoner_004_0.text: I have the strangest dreams. The worst nightmares.

Cells_Prisoner_004_1.speaker: Hapdim
Cells_Prisoner_004_1.text: You're a dream. You must be.

GuardTower_Guard_001_12.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_12.text: You are intruding in the palace of Cazador Szarr. Leave now, citizen.

GuardTower_Guard_001_14.speaker: Narrator
GuardTower_Guard_001_14.text: *She doesn't say a word. In fact, she barely seems there at all.*

GuardTower_Guard_001_30.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_30.text: You cannot be here - it is forbidden.

GuardTower_Guard_001_33.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_33.text: This is the palace of Cazador Szarr. Entry is forbidden. Leave now, citizen.

GuardTower_Guard_001_18.speaker: Narrator
GuardTower_Guard_001_18.text: *The guard's words are clear, but spoken without thought or intent. Behind her eyes you see - nothing. She's a drone under some magical charm.*

GuardTower_Guard_001_2.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Guard_001_2.text: Another word from you and you'll fly out of this tower.

GuardTower_Guard_001_27.speaker: Narrator
GuardTower_Guard_001_27.text: *She pauses for a moment, but keeps her mouth shut. It seems you're free to enter.*

GuardTower_Guard_001_26.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_26.text: My life belongs to the master. I live and die in his service.

GuardTower_Guard_001_50.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Guard_001_50.text: I am inspecting the security, on your master's orders.

GuardTower_Guard_001_36.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_36.text: Of course, whatever the master desires.

GuardTower_Guard_001_41.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_41.text: Enter freely and of your own will.

GuardTower_Guard_001_13.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_13.text: The master needs no 'inspections'. The master sees all.

GuardTower_Guard_001_42.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_42.context: NodeContext: Stressing the last word as a threat

GuardTower_Guard_001_29.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Guard_001_29.text: Cazador hired me for a job - it's very hush, hush. If you don't let me in, he's going to be most upset.

GuardTower_Guard_001_17.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_17.text: The master did not mention you.

GuardTower_Guard_001_51.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Guard_001_51.text: I'm here to kill Cazador Szarr.

GuardTower_Guard_001_48.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_48.text: Protect the palace! Protect the master's sanctuary!

GuardTower_Guard_001_44.speaker: Narrator
GuardTower_Guard_001_44.text: *The guard's words are clear, but spoken without thought or intent. Behind her eyes you see - nothing. She must be one of the charmed thralls Astarion mentioned.*

GuardTower_Guard_001_39.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_39.text: Master Astarion? But the time is almost here - you should be at the ritual.

GuardTower_Guard_001_25.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_25.text: Hurry, the palace is being sealed. You must not be late. You must not anger the master.

GuardTower_Guard_001_45.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Guard_001_45.text: What ritual are you talking about?

GuardTower_Guard_001_28.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_28.text: It is the Ascension - the master expects all his children to attend. You must not be late.

GuardTower_Guard_001_23.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Guard_001_23.text: You'll be free of 'the master' soon. I'll see to that.

GuardTower_Guard_001_37.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_37.text: Free of the master? But the master is freedom. The master is everything.

GuardTower_Guard_001_16.speaker: Merony
GuardTower_Guard_001_16.text: You will be brought to the master. You will answer for your blasphemy.

ElevatorUp_6.speaker: Narrator
ElevatorUp_6.text: *The elevator lies ready to carry you back up to the palace.*

ElevatorUp_2.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorUp_2.text: Let's get out of here. I've had more than my fill of this place.

ElevatorUp_5.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorUp_5.text: Well then, shall we see what this brave new world looks like?

ElevatorUp_7.speaker: Narrator
ElevatorUp_7.text: *You stand on a clean, metal platform - a beautiful but antiquated elevator.*

ElevatorUp_10.speaker: Astarion
ElevatorUp_10.text: This must be the way up to Cazador's palace? Surely?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_44.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_44.text: I believed all our guests had been dealt with upstairs. Werewolves leave so much to be desired.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_26.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_26.text: But as you are here, it would be a shame to waste the audience.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_61.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_61.text: Cazador, I presume? What is going on here?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_85.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_85.text: You came here wholly ignorant? With no concept of what you were about to witness?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_71.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_71.text: This is the Rite of Profane Ascension - attempted only once in legend.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_74.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_74.text: Seven thousand souls, each bearing the scar of the one who brought them to me, stand ready to be sacrificed.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_65.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_65.text: In their blood I shall be reborn, free to walk in the sun's rays. Free from sanguinary hunger. And free to crush any who stand against me with merciless power.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_75.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_75.text: I know all about your ritual. I won't let you go through with it.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_0.text: Ha! You are a worm, lecturing the crow about to consume you.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_46.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_46.text: You will not stop this ritual. Nothing will stop this ritual.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_59.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_59.text: No, your timing is perfect. All is in place.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_1.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_1.text: Wait - no. It cannot be. Were you the one who took my poor Astarion under your wing, only to abandon him so cruelly?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_87.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_87.text: Please, I care not for your petty drama. In truth, you made all of this possible.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_35.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_35.text: Now that he is mine once more, I have everything I need. This ritual - this Black Mass that has been centuries in the making - is finally ready.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_41.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_41.text: Witness the birth of the Vampire Ascendant! Ecce dominus!

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_57.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_57.text: Taken by mind flayers, then monster hunters, then you. That's a run of bad luck.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_27.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_27.text: In my defence, he was being a dick.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_6.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_6.text: Truly? I could have sworn I knew you. Perhaps it is your plain, forgettable face.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_81.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_81.text: But it matters not. You are here now, just as we consummate our most profane rite.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_69.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_69.text: Now this is unexpected. You who follow on the heels of our poor, lost son.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_23.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_23.text: Has he sent you here to parley on his behalf? Will he not even speak to his own family?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_42.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_42.text: He's not coming - and you can't complete this ritual without him.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_79.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_79.text: What do you want from him?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_56.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_56.text: You came here wholly ignorant? With no concept of what you were about to witness?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_39.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_39.text: This is the Rite of Profane Ascension - attempted only once in legend.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_20.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_20.text: Seven thousand souls, each bearing the scar of the one that brought them to me, stand ready to be sacrificed.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_34.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_34.text: In their blood I shall be reborn, free to walk in the sun's rays. Free from sanguinary hunger. And free to crush any that stand against me with merciless power.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_31.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_31.text: Blessed are you to be the first I shall consume when I become the Vampire Ascendant.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_89.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_89.text: He's not coming. You'll never see him again.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_11.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_11.text: And you are certain he will not come to me?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_51.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_51.text: You presume to know the boy better than I? I who made him?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_62.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_62.text: Tell me, then - what is he feeling? Right this moment, in whatever rathole he is cloistered?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_54.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_54.text: He's worried about me and wants me to get back safe.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_76.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_76.text: Ha! Oh, you sweet idiot. No.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_53.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_53.text: He's fine. He's safe from you.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_66.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_66.text: Hardly. Even he knows better than that. Nowhere is safe.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_78.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_78.text: He trusts me to end this.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_17.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_17.text: Trust? Astarion? One of his few redeeming features is that he never trusts anybody.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_13.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_13.text: No, he is afraid. He is afraid because all he has ever known is you and me, and without us he is nothing.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_2.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_2.text: When you do not return from this place, he will want to flee. He will want to leave this city and all its horrors behind. But he won't.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_49.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_49.text: He will come here, because he knows nothing else. Because he is incapable of anything else.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_19.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_19.text: Perhaps he convinces himself he can save you, perhaps he slinks back like a beaten dog. It does not matter, either way he will return. Either way he will be mine.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_22.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_22.text: I won't let you use me as bait.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_25.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_25.text: Please, did Astarion tell you nothing about me?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_18.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_18.text: I am the immortal Cazador Szarr. And I always get what I want.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_40.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_40.text: What if I just bring Astarion to you? I could walk him right in here.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_32.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_32.text: You would turn on him? How delightfully treacherous. Hmm...

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_37.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_37.text: Very well, I give you one chance. Return with my wayward boy, and perhaps I will let you live.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_28.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_28.text: But cross me and, I promise, I will deliver you an eternity of suffering.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_45.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_45.text: I hope we understand each other. Now, go.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_60.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_60.text: I wish I could believe you, I truly do. But alas, I have been cursed with inordinate intelligence and am not about to give up this bird in the hand.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_7.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_7.text: No, you will stay here. You will be mine, now and forever!

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_5.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_5.text: You think you can stand against me?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_3.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_3.text: I am the immortal Cazador Szarr! And you will be mine.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_47.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_47.text: How... succinctly put. Indeed, he is terrified.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_82.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_82.text: And you call yourself his family? You're a monster.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_58.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_58.text: What is family, if not the monsters we are obliged to love?

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_43.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_43.text: That is why he will come back to me. Because he yearns to be with his people. Because this is all he knows.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_10.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_10.text: Oh, you have been an interesting distraction for him, no doubt, but your time together is over.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_64.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_64.text: When you don't return, he will realise he has nowhere else to go. He will come to me. And he will be mine.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_48.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_48.text: You're not his family - you're a monster.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_21.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_21.text: I'm here to discuss handing him over. I can save you a lot of trouble.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_77.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_77.text: A bold offer. And one I would be a fool to accept.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_8.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_8.text: All I need do is ensure you never return to him, and that sweet idiot will soon come searching for you.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_36.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_36.text: No, you are not leaving. Not now, not ever.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_83.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_83.text: My instructions were clear - bring me back the boy or suffer.

RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_68.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_PreCombat_NoAstarion_68.text: I see you chose the latter. Very well, then.

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_0.speaker: Duver Rillyn
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_0.text: No, master favours wolf, not rat.

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_3.speaker: Duver Rillyn
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_3.text: Master not feed wolf to stupid spawn.

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_1.speaker: Duver Rillyn
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_1.text: Stop! No more squeaking. No more rat lies!

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_4.speaker: Duver Rillyn
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_4.text: Stupid rats. Always talking. Always chittering.

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_2.speaker: Duver Rillyn
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_001_2.text: Would eat you all. But master says no...

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_9.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_9.text: Slim pickings up here. But safe. No one grabbing. No one biting.

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_0.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_0.text: In the guts of the palace. Hungry mouths down there.

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_6.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_6.text: You know my brothers and sisters, then?

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_13.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_13.text: Brothers and sisters? Big family. Bigger than mine.

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_8.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_8.text: All those hungry mouths, hiding down in the castle's guts.

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_2.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_2.text: Don't tempt me, you look juicy.

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_3.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_3.text: You're like them! Like the hungry ones in the castle's guts.

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_5.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_5.text: Don't like them. Don't like you.

GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_10.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_004_SwA_10.text: Safe up here. Safe in the light.

RitualRoom_AD_SpawnKilled_001_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_SpawnKilled_001_Combat_0.text: What have you done?! I need them alive, you maggot!
RitualRoom_AD_SpawnKilled_001_Combat_0.context: InternalNodeContext: 'you' referring to player, 'them' referring to his vampire spawn "children"

RitualRoom_AD_LoneAstarionWarning_0.speaker: Astarion
RitualRoom_AD_LoneAstarionWarning_0.text: I'd be a fool to face Cazador alone. Who knows what tricks he has up those moth-ridden sleeves?

Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_0.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_0.text: Thousands of names. This couldn't be part of the ritual... could it?

Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_1.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_1.text: I brought him so many people. So many wasted lives.

Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_2.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_2.text: A list of each and every soul I owe my power to. Thank you, one and all.

Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_3.speaker: Astarion
Crypt_PAD_ScrollOfNames_3.text: He recorded thousands of names. Were they his victims or something else entirely?

RitualRoom_PAD_SpawnKilled_0.speaker: Astarion
RitualRoom_PAD_SpawnKilled_0.context: NodeContext: player just killed the spawn Astarion needs to ascend to power, ruining his plans

RitualRoom_Petras_10.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_10.text: Where is he? What have you done?
RitualRoom_Petras_10.context: InternalNodeContext: Asking Astarion where Cazador isNodeContext: A little worried/tense

RitualRoom_Petras_15.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_15.text: You did it. You destroyed him.

RitualRoom_Petras_7.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_7.text: Are you going to kill us like you killed the others?

RitualRoom_Petras_12.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_12.text: Easy to say, but it's not like we can just march out into the city.

RitualRoom_Petras_4.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_4.text: We're creatures of the shadows. I'm sure you know that feeling well.

RitualRoom_Petras_5.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_5.text: We're still creatures of the shadows. Nothing can change that.

RitualRoom_Petras_9.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Petras_9.text: I do, so why not embrace it? You could make a true home in the Underdark.

RitualRoom_Petras_26.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_26.text: True, we'd never have to fear the sun. Never have to fear vampire hunters.

RitualRoom_Petras_18.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_18.text: We could do worse. We could do well, even.

RitualRoom_Petras_25.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_25.text: Thank you for this chance. For our freedom.

RitualRoom_Petras_33.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Petras_33.text: Do what you like, you're not my problem.

RitualRoom_Petras_13.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_13.text: We're not, but thank you all the same. You didn't have to do any of this.

RitualRoom_Petras_31.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_31.text: We'll find somewhere quiet and consider our options. Good luck up there.

RitualRoom_Petras_19.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Petras_19.text: Maybe I should kill you after all...

RitualRoom_Petras_22.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_22.text: You said I was free! You said I could go!

RitualRoom_Petras_27.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Petras_27.text: That depends. Are you going to start feeding on people?

RitualRoom_Petras_17.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_17.text: I'm sure I can resist. I've survived this long on vermin, after all.

RitualRoom_Petras_29.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_29.text: We can't stay here, though. Baldur's Gate will always have Cazador's shadow hanging over it.
RitualRoom_Petras_29.context: InternalNodeContext: 'his' referring to Cazador, his now-dead abusive masterNodeContext: 'his' referring to Cazador, his now-dead abusive master

RitualRoom_Petras_20.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Petras_20.text: Why not start over in the Underdark?

RitualRoom_Petras_11.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_11.text: You can try, but I'm not some helpless wretch in a cage. I'm going to make you bleed.

RitualRoom_Petras_3.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Petras_3.text: You're free, so... what do you want to happen?

RitualRoom_Petras_16.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_16.text: I... I don't know. We can't stay here, but can't just march out into city either.

RitualRoom_Petras_0.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_Petras_0.text: Easy - now I'm going to kill you.

RitualRoom_Petras_30.speaker: Pale Petras
RitualRoom_Petras_30.text: I've never seen him bleed before. I didn't know it was possible.

RitualRoom_AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat_0.text: Our ritual is near complete. Can you feel its profane power?

Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.text: What in the hells is happening here?
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.context: NodeContext: Feeling the effects of a curse, so slightly strained

Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_3.speaker: Astarion
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_3.text: I entertained our 'guests' here until Cazador appeared and took them away, but I never saw anything like this.
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_3.context: NodeContext: Feeling the effects of a curse, so slightly strained

Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_5.speaker: Astarion
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_5.text: Whatever happened to that girl, it wasn't good.
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_5.context: NodeContext: Feeling the effects of a curse, so slightly strained

Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_2.speaker: Astarion
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_2.text: Ah, the bedrooms. Never once slept in.

Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_4.speaker: Astarion
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_4.text: This is where I took our 'guests'. I'd entertain them here, until Cazador appeared and... took them away.

Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_1.speaker: Astarion
Bedrooms_PAD_AstarionsComment_1.text: No one ever died here, though. Something strange happened to that girl.

PAD_BeforeBallroom_1.speaker: Player
PAD_BeforeBallroom_1.text: | Cazador's tastes run to the lurid and theatrical, don't they? Not my style. |

PAD_BeforeBallroom_4.speaker: Player
PAD_BeforeBallroom_4.text: The décor wasn't my biggest complaint, if I'm honest.

PAD_BeforeBallroom_2.speaker: Player
PAD_BeforeBallroom_2.text: Rats. The lowest of rodents, for the lowest of men!

PAD_BeforeBallroom_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BeforeBallroom_0.text: | I have a bad feeling about this.  |

Dungeon_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Dungeon_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.text: What in the Hells - I never knew any of this was here.

Kennel_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Kennel_PAD_AstarionsComment_0.text: And this is the kennel - a wretched little cell Cazador would lock us in when he was displeased.

Kennel_PAD_AstarionsComment_2.speaker: Astarion
Kennel_PAD_AstarionsComment_2.text: Behold, one of Cazador's cheapest tricks: an illusionary wall.

Kennel_PAD_AstarionsComment_1.speaker: Astarion
Kennel_PAD_AstarionsComment_1.text: And behind it is the kennel - a fetid little cell he'd throw us into when displeased.

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_7.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_7.text: Bleedin' hells, it's you! Made it out afterall, eh?

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_8.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_8.text: Another visitor? Staying long? The others are.

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_9.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_9.text: What others? Who are these visitors?

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_4.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_4.text: Guests. Came for a party. Never left, though.

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_1.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_1.text: Dunno what happened to them. Don't want to know.

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_0.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_0.text: But I'm sure you're different. I'm sure you'll be fine.
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_0.context: NodeContext: Rat doesn't really believe this

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_5.speaker: Player
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_5.text: I'll be leaving as quickly as possible.

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_6.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_6.text: 's what you think. But no one else leaves.

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_3.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_3.text: So many visitors recently. All came for a party. Didn't see none of 'em again.

GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_10.speaker: Giant Rat
GuardTower_Rat_003_SwA_10.text: All goes in, none comes out.

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_2.speaker: Narrator
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_2.text: *Just like the door to the ballroom upstairs, this door features no keyhole, but does have an indentation for a signet ring.*

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_9.speaker: Player
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_9.text: Damn it, I'll have to get that ring.

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_0.speaker: Player
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_0.text: Press the Szarr signet ring to the hollow in the door.

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans forward and is implied to press a ring into a small indentation in the door. (This does not need to be shown - only implied) [REUSE]InternalNodeContext: Same animation as the cinematic node in LOW_CazadorsPalace_Ballroom_MainDoor.lsj

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_7.speaker: Narrator
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_7.text: *The ring slots perfectly into place and the door opens, assailing you with a pungent, musty air.*

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_4.speaker: Narrator
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_4.text: *Just like the door to the ballroom upstairs, this door features no keyhole, but does have an indentation for a signet ring.*

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_5.speaker: Player
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_5.text: Damn it, I'll have to get that ring.

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_10.speaker: Player
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_10.text: Press the Szarr signet ring to the hollow in the door.

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans forward and is implied to press a ring into a small indentation in the door. (This does not need to be shown - only implied) [REUSE]InternalNodeContext: Same animation as the cinematic node in LOW_CazadorsPalace_Ballroom_MainDoor.lsj

Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_8.speaker: Narrator
Dungeon_DoorWithProtection_8.text: *The ring slots perfectly into place and the door opens, assailing you with a pungent, musty air.*

RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_3.speaker: Predator Werewolf
RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_3.text: Master will ascend. Master will rule.

RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_4.speaker: Predator Werewolf
RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_4.text: Stupid spawn. Only toys for master.

RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_1.speaker: Predator Werewolf
RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_1.text: We are better than spawn. Stronger than spawn.

RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_8.speaker: Predator Werewolf
RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_8.text: Can you smell it? Blood. Fear.

RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_0.speaker: Predator Werewolf
RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_0.text: The cattle know. Know the slaughter is here.

RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_9.speaker: Predator Werewolf
RitualRoom_AD_RitualBarks_9.text: Master will walk in the sun. Master will lead us.

Mansion_AD_Bust_0.speaker: Narrator
Mansion_AD_Bust_0.text: *Mordoc SeLanmere, the Pale Knight. The self-proclaimed king of vampires.*

Mansion_AD_Bust_1.speaker: Narrator
Mansion_AD_Bust_1.text: *The inscription on this bust reads 'Mordoc SeLanmere'. One of Cazador's ancestors, perhaps?*

RitualRoom_AD_ResponseToAstarion_001_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_ResponseToAstarion_001_0.text: I have known you for two centuries. Have I not suffered enough?

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_002_0.speaker: Blaise Hhune
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_002_0.text: Master not here. You obey me. Sit!

Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_002_1.speaker: Blaise Hhune
Ballroom_AD_Werewolf_002_1.text: Stupid wolves. You will sit. You will obey!

Dungeon_PAD_PrisonersAstarionsComment_0.speaker: Astarion
Dungeon_PAD_PrisonersAstarionsComment_0.text: There's so many of them. Who the hells are these people?

Cells_Child_003_0.speaker: Vanja
Cells_Child_003_0.text: Why did you bring us here? Why did you do this to us?

Cells_Child_003_1.speaker: Vanja
Cells_Child_003_1.text: I just want to go home...

GuardTower_Guard_002_1.speaker: Jaryd
GuardTower_Guard_002_1.text: It's time - the Ascension is here.

GuardTower_Guard_002_2.speaker: Jaryd
GuardTower_Guard_002_2.text: Enter freely and leave something of the happiness you bring.

RitualRoom_AD_BuffRemoved_002_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_BuffRemoved_002_Combat_0.text: Strip away every power if you wish. It will not save you.

RitualRoom_AD_BuffRemoved_001_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_BuffRemoved_001_Combat_0.text: Well played. But I still have power enough to rend the flesh from your bones.
RitualRoom_AD_BuffRemoved_001_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: Almost impressed that the pathethic player did something smart. But it won't save them.

RitualRoom_AD_TeleportingAstarionToRitua.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_TeleportingAstarionToRitua.text: At last! Time to take your place, boy.

RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_1P_1.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_1P_1.text: Those runes are leeching the spawns' power and sending it straight to Cazador.

RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_1P_0.speaker: Player
RitualRoom_PAD_Runes_1P_0.text: But if I can reach them, maybe I can redirect that power to me.

RitualRoom_AD_SpawnFreed_002_Combat_0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
RitualRoom_AD_SpawnFreed_002_Combat_0.text: You meddlesome little wretch. They belong to me!

Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_0.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_0.text: You! Can't be here. No one in. No one out.

Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_5.speaker: Astarion
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_5.text: You're new. Cazador never kept guard dogs before.

Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_10.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_10.text: The runaway spawn! You reek of the master's scent.

Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_1.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_1.text: Come with us. Come to master.

Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_9.speaker: Astarion
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_9.text: Excuse me? I will not be ordered around my own house by some blow-in mutt!

Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_2.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_2.text: We bring you to him. We get his favour.

Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_4.speaker: Gheris Hhune
Ballroom_WerewolvesAttack_4.text: Runaway spawn! The master's scent is all over you.
